ColorSandbox.pageDescription: Observe how RGB, HSL, and Oklch handle color transitions and display vibrant colors. Oklch is particularly adept at predictable lightness and accessing wider color gamuts (like P3).

rgbNotes.transitions: Transitions: Generally smooth but can have perceived shifts in brightness.
rgbNotes.gamut: Gamut: Typically sRGB. Colors outside this range are clipped.

hslNotes.transitions: Transitions: Can be unpredictable, especially with saturation or lightness changes (e.g., gray "dead zones" when transitioning hues at high/low L/S).
hslNotes.gamut: Gamut: Typically sRGB. Can lead to unexpected color shifts if trying to represent P3 colors directly.
hslNotes.use: Use: Human-readable, but often less perceptually uniform.

oklchNotes.transitions: Transitions: Perceptually uniform. Changes in Lightness (L) are predictable. Hue transitions avoid unexpected shifts in brightness/saturation.
oklchNotes.gamut: Gamut: Can represent colors far outside sRGB, suitable for P3 and Rec.2020 displays. Gracefully handles out-of-gamut colors by finding the closest in-gamut color at the same lightness and hue.
oklchNotes.hdrExample: Example HDR (P3): This vibrant purple ({colorString}) might only render correctly on a P3 display.
oklchNotes.use: Use: Modern, perceptually uniform, wide gamut support.
oklchNotes.targetInstruction: Global Picker Target: <swatch></swatch> Adjust Oklch sliders to make this section's main preview match it.

gamutNotes.sRgbClipped: Displayed sRGB color is clipped from a wider gamut source.
gamutNotes.sRgbClippedHsl: Displayed HSL (sRGB) is derived from a wider gamut source.
